name: Novotel Monte Carlo

reviews.text: I stayed at the Novotel for the Historic Grand Prix weekend as well as another hotel due to lack of availability for the Saturday night.
reviews.title: Good hotel and well located for the Grand Prix

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and efficient, we stayed on the 7th floor and the room was a good size with a nice bathroom and good shower. The quality of the room finish could be a bit better but there is nothing too wrong with it.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: The lobby and bar area is very trendy for a Novotel property with a F1 and Racing theme in the décor with a lot of funky statues.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast at the hotel is good, my only complaint is that the coffee machines do not make great coffee and the milk they use is powdered which is not great if you like your coffee in the mornings.
reviews.title: Bit of luxury for this usual middle of the road hotel stayer!

reviews.text: There is a pool at the hotel which was a nice surprise but it is very shallow, starting at 75cm deep and shelving off rather slowly to the deep end. This is ok but not great if you like doing laps in the pool.
reviews.title: Not fancy-pancy but works for business and leisure

reviews.text: I was here in 2009, and really enjoyed the Novotel then. It still provides a great value with a good location. It's close to the train stop in Monaco, and is also on the major bus route, which makes getting around and to other locations nearby a breeze.
reviews.title: Still a great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are basic, but decent size, some of them have balconies and fantastic views of the castle and Port Hercule. The beds are firm, which I like.
reviews.title: Fantastic, Friendly and Helpful!

reviews.text: It is a short and easy downhill walk to the Casino and Hotel de Paris. I have to mention a great coffee shop nearby called Costa. I highly recommend this place for your morning coffee/pastry. It's just across the street and down a block and a half from Novotel. There is also a great Italian restaurant nearby, just up the hill from Novotel, which, oddly enough, is called "Restaurant".
reviews.title: Very good choice
give them your money to stay at home!
reviews.text: I booked for this hotel and prepaid throught there website.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The day before travel a elderly relative fell ill and I was unable to travel.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel

likes.disliked: — Having to walk up the hill after a night out!

reviews.text: The hotel give me no help at all! they just told me tough I had prepaid, they wont refund me and they were not prepared to move the dates!
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.disliked: — Yukky cushions, paying for WiFi access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I lost 260 euros for nothing and they were not flexable in any way.
reviews.title: Good Location, Great Friendly Service

likes.liked: — Friendly, modern, clean, pool, convenient location & services.
likes.disliked: — Parking could have been a little cheaper, but car park is highly secure & well run.

reviews.text: so cannot tell you what the hotel is like but can tell you dont pre pay as they get to have the money for nothing if there is a problem
reviews.title: Fab 4 Family of Five

reviews.text: This hotel is good value for money in a place where hotel rates can be sky high. It is an above-average Novotel, with friendly, efficient staff, good public rooms, bar and restaurant, and excellent, free, high-speed wi-fi. The room and bathroom were better than average (it was an executive room), although the space for hanging and storing clothes was very limited (as usual in Novotels). I can recommend this place!
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: I stayed at the Novotel for 1 night and was very pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. I arrived in Monaco by the direct airport bus from Nice Airport, the Novotel was the 1st stop. The hotel reception is very light and airy and the staff were welcoming and friendly. My room was spacious and clean and the bathroom had a separate shower and lots of toiletries, helpful when your travelling hand luggage only. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Monaco, with the Casino Square just a few minutes walk down the hill and the train station is also only a few minutes walk away so you can use the lifts and escalators to easily access the various areas of Monte Carlo. Breakfast was delicious and the outdoor pool and garden are a great bonus.
reviews.title: Great hotel and excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in February 2010, nice hotel and good location. Everything you would expect from a 4 star hotel, can't say anything bad about the place or service other than it is what you would expect, no more, no less.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and good location

reviews.text: We had booked 2 rooms at this hotel for New Year's eve 2008, a once in a lifetime experience, our parties having travelled from the USA and South Africa respectively. The hotel staff were very unfriendly (reception) and unwelcoming. I know no-one wants to work on New Year's eve but for the people checking in, the introduction to the hotel was really hostile. In most of the hotels we have ever stayed in - umbrellas are available for guests, when I phoned to inquire about an umbrella (as it was raining outside), I was told curtly that they had SOLD OUT of same!!! Won't be staying here again - only good thing about the hotel is the cleanliness of the rooms and the position of same.
reviews.title: Rude staff but well situated hotel

reviews.text: Novotel was one of the only hotels in Monaco which provided a family room. The kids went free which made it way more affordable. The rooms have a really comfortable double bed and a settee which pulls out into either one or two single beds. Not much room left when all beds are made up. As we didn't spend a lot of time in the room it wasn't really a problem. Lots to see and do around the city.
reviews.title: Great Value in Monaco

likes.disliked: — Toilet room was very small and separate from Bathroom and wash basin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated very near the train station. Make sure you take the correct exit from the station. We used the public elevators and passage ways through the station to access the port area.
reviews.title: Modern and clean

reviews.text: The breakfasts in the hotel had a good selection of plentiful food. We ate there one night and though the slection was a bit limited the food was good and the service excellent.
reviews.title: Affordable Hotel - Great Staff

reviews.text: Overall the staff were friendly and helpful and all spoke english. I would recommend this hotel for an affordable stay in Monaco.
reviews.title: Very trendy rooms

reviews.text: Well the Best thing about the hotel is the location! Near the casino and a 10 minute walk to the port, which you do have to walk down 2 killer section of stairs as a major shortcut to it, made it a great base for exploring the city. It is also very near the station but make sure you get the right exit as we didn't and made our walk much longer! Rooms nice, good bathroom and liked the idea of a seperate toilet. We had a huge balcony and were lucky enough to have a great view of the port. Ate at resturant for dinner one night and enjoyed it a lot, expensive but its expensive everywhere in Monaco! Had breakfast on the second day but thats where there wa a problem, service was bad, couldn't cope with the latecomers and didn't ask us if we wanted tea and only asked about coffee. One area i can't comment on is value for money as i went with a friend and his family and so didn't know the cost of the trip, Nice touch of having an outdoor swimming pool as well. I would definitly think about staying there again and telling people about it!
reviews.title: A Great Base in a hilly City!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only confirm many of the previous reviews.
reviews.title: Excellent Value; for Monaco!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent value (compare their prices with those higher rated under tripadvisor!), clean and comfortable, well located and very good selection at breakfast. Only down side was slightly rude staff when we checked in; staff when we checked out couldn't have been nicer!
reviews.title: Very trendy and good hotel

reviews.text: Unless you have mega bucks to spend in Monaco, this is the place to stay!
reviews.title: Excellent value in a wonderful place

reviews.text: We arrived, checked in quickly with the member of staff giving us a map and some info straight away. Lovely room, nicely spaced out and good size. The bar and restaurant were especially nice. Trendy deco and great atmosphere. We ate in the restaurant and had drinks at the bar. Both expensive but in Monaco that's normal!!! However food was amazing, staff were very friendly and helpful in recommendations for meals. Overall good hotel, well siutated. About 10 minutes walk from the sea front, 7 mins from the casino (which is a lovely walk through the grounds) and the only thing I didn't like is the hill the hotel was on top of! :-)
reviews.title: This would be a 4 star hotel anywhere else.

reviews.text: As basic as possible of Novotels,U can not expact them to be More than they show they are,Not bad at all,also we should remember that U R in Expansive "Monte Carlo".
reviews.title: Like Many Other NOVOTELS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean hotel, with an average room size in standard accommodation. Free wifi provided but this is very slow and only really usefull for catching up on email. location is pretty good with the bus stop only a few minutes walk away, you can take the bus literally everywhere. Buy a one day bus pass and you can travel unlimited number of times per day (bus stops running around 10pm though). 10 minutes away from Monte Carlo Casino and Hotel De Paris with the lovel fountain gardens at the front with surrounding high end shops nearby by. The Novotels restaurant food is average with the price the same though not cheap. The restaurant closes at 10pm though however you can get a limited selection of food as room service. The breakfast closes a bit too early at 10am. There is a small gym onsite and an equally small swimming pool. I Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super comfy room and bed. 4 min walk to train stations for trains from Italy and France. Supermarket in walking distance. We loved it and would come again.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: best hotel for the budget traveller. if like me, you want to do monaco on a budget this is class. rooms are surely a 4* standard and have been back since. worth paying for the garden view room as these overlook the harbour and palace ('city view' is slightly confusing as faces up the hill just at other hotels etc). pool is small but enough, and the garden is a real escape.
reviews.title: immense value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bit of a mssion from st devote, i pulled 2 20k caes with me and was literally dripping sweat. taxi is an option of course but i have scotish roots so like to persevere and save £10.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Were quite pleased when we found this hotel, one of the cheapest hotels we stayed at in one of the most expensive countries in the world!! Don't knwo how that worked!! Everything was nice about the hotel. However id advise taking the bus service instead of walking, as there is A LOT of uphill and downhill, and crazy drivers!! I didnt find monaco that expensive to buy general basic products, its a very nice place and i wish we spent more time there!!
reviews.title: good value!

description: Its enviable location, ideally situated in the very heart of the Principality, strong design and array of services make the Novotel Monte Carlo an attractive offering. Just steps away from the Place du Casino and the Grimaldi Forum, only 100 metres from prestigious stores in Monaco's shopping area, close to the railway station, the beach which can be reached on foot, the hotel boasts a breathtaking view of the bay and the famous Rock.
